name: G 9-40
scenarioDescription:
The G 9-40 Exoplanetary System


Overview

G 9-40 is a star with 0.29 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.31 times its radius. It is located 91.10 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 9.9 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

G 9-40 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the G 9-40 system


G 9-40 b

G 9-40 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of G 9-40 b is 2.025 that of Earth.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system G 9-40, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by K2.
